original: Ekelund, Sigvard Frans August, agr. lic., Halmstad, f. 27/8/13 i Lund av marindir. Carl A. E. o. Iris Persson. G. 44 m. Miarianne Wingårdh. Barn: Rolf f. 45, Lili-Anne 47. — Stud:ex. i Malmö 31, ’stud. i ryska v. Uppsala univ. 36-37, agronomex. 39, agr. -lic. 44. Stud :re:s. t. TysM. 22, 23, 25 o. 38, Sovjetunionen 35. Aman. v. ’1’antbr :högsk. kem. inst. 34 o. 36-38, .assist. ;där 39-44, e. o. ämneslär. v. Tomelilla lantmannask. 44-45, lab:chef v. Sv. A-B Vato i Halmstad sed. 45. Förest, f. Sv:es agronomförb. tj :förmedl. 37-38, ordf. i Lantbr :högsk. assist :fören. 42-44, sekr. i Lantbr :högsk. referentkl. 42-44. Skr.: Om ihöskördens sockerhalt o. faktorer som inverka därpå (tills. m. O. Svanbeirg 43), Grönioderensiilering-ens utveckl. (45), Determining redu-cing sugar (46), kompend. v. lantbr :-högsk., art. i fackpressen. Erh. LA forskn :und :stöd ur B’ergstens fond 42-45. Hobby: skogsdikesgrävning.
translated: Ekelund, Sigvard Frans August, agronomist and licentiate, from Halmstad, born on August 27, 1913 in Lund to Navy Officer Carl A. E. and Iris Persson. Married in 1944 to Miarianne Wingårdh. They have two children: Rolf, born in 1945, and Lili-Anne, born in 1947. Ekelund completed his study in Malmö in 1931, studied Russian at Uppsala University from 1936-1937, and earned his agronomist degree in 1939 and his agronomist licentiate degree in 1944. He studied abroad in Germany in 1922, 1923, 1925, and 1938, and in the Soviet Union in 1935. He worked as assistant at the Chemical Institution of the Royal Swedish Academy of Agriculture and Forestry in 1934 and from 1936-1938, and as a temporary subject teacher at Tomelilla Farmer's School from 1944-1945. He has been the laboratory manager at Svenska AB Vato in Halmstad since 1945. Ekelund was a founder and chairman of the Swedish Agronomist Association's Career Service from 1937-1938, chairman of the Agricultural College Assistant Association from 1942-1944, and secretary of the Agricultural College Referee Club from 1942-1944. He has written articles in professional journals, including "Determining Reducing Sugar" (1946). He received research funding from the Bergsten Foundation from 1942-1945. His hobby is digging forest ditches.

organization.name: Chemical Institution of the Royal Swedish Academy of Agriculture and Forestry
